glsa.title: Bash: Code Injection
glsa.synopsis: A parsing flaw related to functions and environments in Bash could allow attackers to inject code.

background.p: Bash is the standard GNU Bourne Again SHell.

description.p: Stephane Chazelas reported that Bash incorrectly handles function definitions, allowing attackers to inject arbitrary code.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands even in restricted environments.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
